ABOUT EXHIBITIONS ATLAS
Gap Particles. Images of fragments, printed on silk and unravelled. Photos by me and Nathan Caldecott, 2020.
Detail from the Unravelled Series. Billboard installation. Photo by Julien Bader.
Meadow 672. Images tracing the history of the exhibition site of this work, a recently developed container village. Digitally printed silk. Installed at Art Night, photo by Peter Otto, 2019.
Corrupted Series. Images retrieved via trash-recovery software from my computer. Digitally printed silk. Photos by me and Like A Little Disaster. 2013.
Collective Vomit. Images found via trash-recovery software on USB sticks belonging to participants of a workshop held at Baltic Centre for Contemporary Art, 2014.
Terms and Conditions. One fifth of Airbnb’s T&C we agree to when using their service. Marker on dust-sheet. Photo by Gert Jan van Rooij, 2015.
I Need, Trust Me, Help Me. Appeals from my spam folder. Acrylic/marker on cling film/dust-sheet. Photos by me, 2015.
Veintre de Tiburón. Image found on used USB sticks bought in the informal markets of Cali. Digitally printed silk. Photo by Jamie Jenkinson. 2014.
Zebras, Blanks and Blobs. Image families from the University of Edinburgh’s collections. Artist book. Photos by Tenderbooks, 2017.
Zebras, Blanks and Blobs (Windows). Commissioned by the University of Edinburgh, installed at the University of Edinburgh. Photos by Antonia Reeve, 2017.
Hits and Misses (from the archive). One of the University of Edinburgh’s collection entries which at the time of Hits and Misses had never been clicked-on. Installed at Talbot Rice Gallery, photos by Chris Park, 2015.
Hits and Misses (from the archive). The entire digitised collection of the University of Edinburgh. Digitally printed silk. Installed at Talbot Rice Gallery, photos by Chris Park, 2015.
Recovered VII. Images retrieved via trash-recovery software from my computer. Digitally printed silk. Photo by me, 2012.
